courses.description: This course identifies and provides a framework for analysing the major financial decisions by a firm. Issues addressed include valuation, investment decision-making, analysis of risk, financial planning, dividend policy, working capital management, and the financing mix for the firm.
courses.enrollment_requirement:

~ Leverage and Risks; Making Financing Decisions
~ Capital Structure Decisions
~ Dividend Policy

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Introduction to Empirical Methods in Finance
courses.description: This course introduces to students selected topics in applied statistics which are useful to financial data analysis and research. It provides students with the concepts of regression techniques widely applied in finance, and their hand-on applications and interpretations. Topics include linear regression models, selected introductory topics in regression analysis and time series analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Pre-requisites: DOTE2011 or FINA2220
2. Not for students who have taken ECON2121
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students should be able to:
(1) Master a range of basic quantitative analytical tools in applied statistics.
(2) Have working knowledge of Excel in terms of basic data analysis task.
(3) Interact with financial analysts who speak in the jargon of statistics.
(4) Develop skills and ability to solve problems that they will need to succeed in a business environment.
courses.course_syllabus:
Review of Basic Concepts in Statistics
Simple and Multiple Linear Regression Models
Financial Model Building
Some Pitfalls in Financial Data Analysis
Introduction to time Series Analysis
Volatility Modeling
courses.feedback_evaluation: CTE by end of the term
courses.required_readings: Chris Brooks, Introductory Econometrics for Finance, 2E, Cambridge University Press.
courses.recommended_readings:
Levine et al. Statistics for Managers Using Microsoft Excel, 5th Edition, Prentice Hall 2008.
William Mendenhall & Terry Sincich, A Second Course in Statistics: Regression Analysis, 7th Edition, Pearson Prentice Hall - Chapters 1,2,3,4,5,7,8,11 and 12.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Introduction to Actuarial Science
courses.description:
This is the first course in actuarial science. The goal of this course is to provide an in depth discussion of financial mathematics for actuarial use and an introduction to risk management.

Advisory: elementary calculus as pre-requisite
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing this course, students would be familiar with:
Present and accumulated values for level as well as varying streams of cash flows (including m-thly and continuous payments), actuarial notations, loan and bond amortization, interest risk management using immunization and interest rate swaps, introduction to derivatives.

在完成本科後， 學生將會熟悉：
現值和期值 (包括等額和非等額年計、一年 m 次和連續現金流 )、精算符號、分期貸款和債券攤銷、利用免疫策略和利率掉期進行利率風險管理、衍生工具簡介。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics include:
(1) Different interest rate conventions, including effective rate, discount rate, discount factor, force of interest, rates convertible
m-thly, real and nominal rate
(2) Actuarial notations and calculation for the following cash flows for yearly, m-thly and continuous payment frequencies:
annuity certain, annuity due and perpetuity, including both level, arithmetically varying, and geometrically varying payments
(3) Loan amortization and sinking fund
(4) Bond amortization schedule
(5) Term structure of interest rate, forward rates, duration and convexity
(6) Interest rate risk management technique including Redington immunization and cash flow matching
(7) Introduction to derivative securities such as a interest rate swaps and related risk management concepts

內容包括：
(1) 不同種類的利率, 包括有效利率、折扣率、貼現率、利息強度、一年 m 次年利率、實利率與名義利率
(2) 下列現金流 ( 年計、一年 m 次和連續 ) 的精算符號與運算：即期年金、即付年金、永續年金, 包括等額現金流、等差級數和等比級數現金流
(3) 分期貸款和償債基金
(4) 債券攤銷
(5) 利率期限結構、遠期利率、存續期和凸性
(6) 利率風險管理，包括 Redington 免疫策略和现金流匹配
(7) 衍生工具如利率掉期和相關風險管理既念簡介
courses.feedback_evaluation:
- Course Teaching Evaluation (to be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures)
- Student-staff consultation meeting
- E-mail communication with the instructor
courses.required_readings:
- Chan and Tse, 2013. Financial Mathematics for Actuaries, Updated Edition, McGraw-Hill Education (Asia)
- McDonald, 2012. Derivatives Markets, 3rd Ed., Pearson.
courses.recommended_readings:
- Kellison, 2009. The Theory of Interest, 3rd Ed., Irwin / McGraw-Hill.
- Hull, 2014. Option, Futures and Other Derivatives, 9th Ed., Prentice Hall.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Interest Theory and Finance
courses.description: This course discusses the mathematical and technical aspects of the theory of interest in both discrete and continuous time. Topics include: measurement of interest and discount rates, accumulated value and present value, annuities, sinking funds, amortization of debt, determination of yield rates on securities. Applications include: bond evaluation, mortgages,depreciation methods and life insurance. This course provides the foundation for the study of actuarial mathematics.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken FINA2200.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The goal of this course is to provide an understanding of the fundamental concepts of ﬁnancial mathematics, and how those concepts are applied in calculating present and accumulated values for various streams of cash ﬂows as a basis for future use in: reserving, valuation, pricing, duration calculation, asset/liability management, investment income, capital budgeting and valuing contingent cash ﬂows.
金流計算現值及累積值的計算，學習在計算準備金，定價，期限，資產／負債管理，投資收入，資本預算及或有現金流的價值計算時的各樣基本金融知識。
courses.course_syllabus:
Interest Accumulation and Time Value of Money, Annuities, Spot Rates, Forward Rates and the Term Structure, Rates of Return, Loans and Costs of Borrowing, Bonds and Bond Pricing, Bond Yields and the Term Structure, Bond Management, Stochastic Interest Rates
利息累積及金錢的時間值，年金，即期利率及遠期利率，利率的期限結構，回報率，借貸及借貸成本，債券及債券定價，債券收益率及期限結構，債券管理，隨機利率
courses.feedback_evaluation:
• Course Teaching Evaluation. To be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures.
• Focus-group meeting.
• E-mail communications with the instructor.
• Performance in test/examination/essay/presentation. Assessment of what has been achieved by the students.
courses.required_readings: Financial Mathematics for Actuaries, Chan, W.S., Tse, Y.K., McGraw Hill 2011.
courses.recommended_readings: The Theory of Interest, Kellison, S.G., Irwin McGraw Hill 1991.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Quantitative Methods for Actuarial Analysis I
courses.description: The purpose of this course is to develop knowledge of the fundamental mathematical tools for quantitatively assessing risk. The application of these tools to problems encountered inactuarial analysis is emphasized. Topics include derivatives and integrals of multivariate functions, simple differential equations, general probability, Bayes' Theorem, univariate and multivariate probability distributions.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The purposes of this course are
(1) to introduce tools in probability theory for quantitatively assessing risk, and
(2) to build a solid background in mathematics for uses in later courses.
After following FINA2220, students are expected to be
• familiar with the basic mathematical tools that are useful in actuarial science
• able to use probability to analyze risk
able to handle calculations involving univariate and multivariate probability distributions
本科旨在：
(1) 介紹概率論作為數理分析風險之工具；
(2) 為其他科目建立一穩固的數學基礎。
完成FINA2220的學生將熟習：
• 運用於精算學上的基本數學工具
• 運用概率分析風險
• 一元與多元概率分佈之運算方法
courses.course_syllabus:
(1) General probability:
Set notation, independent and mutually exclusive events, addition and multiplication law, combinatorics, conditional probability and Bayes’ theorem
(2) Univariate probability distributions:
The binomial, negative binomial, geometric, hypergeometric, Poisson, uniform, exponential, chi-square, beta, Pareto, lognormal, gamma, Weibull, and normal distribution. Probability mass function / density function, distribution function, quantiles and percentiles, mean and variance, mode and median, moment generating function, transformation
(3) Multivariate probability distributions:
Joint pmf/pdf, joint distribution, the bivariate normal distribution, joint MGF, conditional and marginal distribution, cova riance and correlation, order statistics, the central limit theorem
(1) 概率論：
集合的記法，獨立與互斥事件，概率之加法和乘法定律，組合，條件概率與貝葉氏定理。
(2) 一元概率分佈：
二項、負二項、幾何、超幾何、泊松、均勻、指數、卡方、貝他、柏拉圖、對數正態、伽瑪、韋伯與正態分佈。概率質量/密度函數，分佈函數，四分位數與百分位數，期望值，方差，眾數與中位數。矩母函數，概率分佈之變換。
(3) 多元概率分佈：
聯合概率質量/密度函數與分佈，二元正態分佈，聯合矩母函數，條件與邊際分佈，協方差與相關係數，次序統計量，中央極限定理。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
• Course Teaching Evaluation. To be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures.
• Focus-group meeting.
• E-mail communications with the instructor.
• Performance in test/examination/essay/presentation. Assessment of what has been achieved by the students.

courses.recommended_readings:
Elementary level:
• S. Ghahramani (2005). Fundamentals of Probability. 3rd Ed., Prentice Hall.
• R. V. Hogg and E. A. Tanis (2001). Probability and Statistical Inference. 6th Ed., Prentice Hall. Advanced level:
• W. Feller (1968). An Introduction to Probability Theory and its Applications, Volume I. 3rd Ed., John Wiley and Sons.
• D. Williams (2001). Weighing the Odds − A Course in Probability and Statistics, Cambridge University Press.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Quantitative Methods for Actuarial Analysis II
courses.description: This course is a continuation of FINA2220. It covers theories in mathematical statistics that are useful in actuarial analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisites: FINA2220 or STAT2001 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the course students are expected to acquire a strong foundation in estimation and statistical inference. Topics include:
Sampling distribution, methods and properties of estimation, confidence intervals, concepts of hypothesis testing including Neyman-Pearson lemma, likelihood ratio test, Fisher information, model selection.

在完成本科後，學生將會得到估量法與假設檢定之堅實基礎。本科將檢討：
抽樣分佈、不同估量法之特性、置信區間、假設檢定之理論，包括 NP 引理、似然比測試、費希爾資訊、模型選擇。
courses.course_syllabus:
The general scope of the course content includes:
(1) Sampling distribution including the chi-square, t and F distribution
(2) Point estimation: including method of moments, maximum likelihood estimation, and the application of criteria such as consistency, unbiasedness and minimum variance
(3) Tests of statistical hypotheses, including power functions, Type I and Type II errors, Neyman-Pearson lemma, likelihood test
(4) Applications of sampling distributions to confidence intervals and to tests for means and variances, chi-square test of
goodness of fit
(5) Bayesian statistics

內容包括：
(1) 抽樣分佈 (卡方, t, F 分佈)
(2) 點估量：矩估計、最大似然法、估量標準確 ( 如一至性、無偏差、最小方差 )
(3) 假設檢定，包括效能、第一類與第二類錯誤、NP 引理、似然比測試
(4) 抽樣分佈對於平均與方差之置信區間與假設檢定之應用，卡方適合度檢定
(5) 貝業氏統計
courses.feedback_evaluation:
- Course Teaching Evaluation (to be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures)
- Student-staff consultation meeting
- E-mail communication with the instructor

courses.recommended_readings:

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Fundamentals of Business Finance
courses.description: This course introduces non-business students to the foundations for finance. It identifies and provides a framework for analysing major financial decisions of a firm. Issues addressed include valuation, investment decision-making, analysis of risk, financial planning, dividend policy, working capital management and the financing mix for the firm. This course will also provide the economics and accounting background necessary for fundamental financial analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken ECON3540, FINA2010 or FINA2110.
courses.course_syllabus: Time Value of Money: Concepts and Applications, Bond and Stock Valuation, Making Investment Decisions: Capital Budgeting, Leverage and Risks, Capital Structure Decisions, Dividend Policy, Working Capital Management, Evaluating Financial Performance
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Focus group discussions with at least two small groups of students
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors
courses.required_readings:
Fundamentals of Corporate Finance, by Stephen A. Ross, Randolph W. Westerfield, Bradford D. Jordan. McGraw-Hill Education, Twelfth Edition. ISBN-13: 978-1-260-09190-8.
Other materials, including lecture notes, will be made available to participants in the week preceding the relevant session of the module.

~ Asian Wall Street Journal, Financial Times, South China Morning Post
~ Business Week, The Economist, Far Eastern Economic Review, Forbes, Fortune
~ 信報（Hong Kong Economic Journal），經濟日報（Hong Kong Economic Times）

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Financial Markets
courses.description: This course deals with a number of financial instruments traded in the markets for securities, foreign exchange, options and futures. Discussions include intersectoral flow-of-funds analysis, determination of interest rates and analysis of money and capital markets.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken ECON3520.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course aims to provide an overview of the role of financial sector and the functions of different financial instruments traded in key financial markets, with particular emphasis to the Hong Kong environment. Interest rate and its impact on financial markets will also be discussed.
courses.course_syllabus:
~ Introduction
~ Interest Rates
~ Foreign Exchange Market
~ Debt Securities Market
~ Equity Securities Market
~ Derivative Securities Market
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors

courses.recommended_readings:

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: International Finance
courses.description: This course aims to analyse international monetary relations and problems. Major areas of discussion include basic concepts and analysis of the balance of payments, the foreign exchange market, determination of spot and forward exchange rates, international capital flows, the payments adjustment mechanism, international monetary problems and arrangements, and international debt and its development.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.course_syllabus: To examine decision-making in International Business Finance via a broad study of the opportunities and problems encountered when financial decisions are made across national boundaries. Emphasis will be placed on how conventional financial models require modifications in a global context, and on the use of international financial markets to control risks and maximize firm value.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors
courses.required_readings: ~ Multinational Business Finance, Eiteman, Stonehill and Moffett, 12th Edition (Global edition available) 2010 (ESM)
courses.recommended_readings:
~【貨幣、外匯及股市】蘇偉文、梁嘉銳、殷偉憲，明報出版社，2003。
~【香港資產市場】蘇偉文、梁嘉銳，明報出版社，2004。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Management of Financial Institutions
courses.description: This course discusses the economic and environmental problems in the acquisition and use of funds by financial institutions. The emphasis is on the fundamental principles underlying the organization and management of a commercial bank. Considerations are given to recent developments in banking regulations, electronic banking, asset and liability management, various major policy areas and their interrelationships.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: After taking this course, students are expected to know the nature of banking and other financial institutions and the role of financial institutions in society and the regulatory environment set up to protect those roles
courses.course_syllabus: The nature of banking, liquidity management, capital adequacy and interest rate risk, credit risk, probanker, commercial bank, asset management, valuation of bank equity, securitization, the banking crisis, credit default swaps, constellation: distribution of minibonds
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructor
courses.required_readings: Brueggeman, William B. and Jeffrey D. Fisher, Real Estate Finance and Investments (15th Edition or other recent editions.), McGraw-Hill
courses.recommended_readings:
David C. Ling and Wayne R. Archer, 2009, Real Estate Principles: A Value Approach (3nd ed.), McGraw-Hill.
Brown & Matysiak, Real Estate Investment, (2000)
Waxman, P. 2004, Investing in Residential Property: Understanding the Australian Property Market (6 Edition), Wrightbooks, Melbourne.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Central Banking and Regulation of Financial Institutions
courses.description: This course deals with the structure and operations of commercial and central banks. It examines supply of money, process of deposit creation in commercial banks, the tools and impact of monetary policy and the role of central banking in the banking industry. It also considers banking practices in an international context.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisites: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken GLEF4020.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Upon completion of the course, students should be able to:
~ Explain the relationship between money, banking and the economy.
~ Explain how money is created and how money supply is measured.
~ Describe the roles and functions of central banks and how they are performed in different countries and Hong Kong.
~ Describe the structure of the banking systems and their regulatory systems in different countries and Hong Kong.
~ Explain the structure and determination of interest rates.
~ Illustrate how the tools of monetary control are operated, and the relationship between monetary base and money supply.
~ Explain the monetary system and the Linked Exchange Rate system in Hong Kong.
~ Illustrate the various ways that monetary policies can be implemented, including those used by the Hong Kong Monetary Authority.
~ Identify international banking activities and explain the procedures used in the import/export financing of foreign trade.
courses.course_syllabus:
~ Introduction to money and banking
~ Banks, Central Banks and Banking Regulations
~ The Monetary Theory and Interest Rates
~ Formulation and Implementation of Monetary Policy
~ International Banking
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors
courses.required_readings: Frederic S. Mishkin, The Economics of Money, Banking, and Financial Markets, 12th edition, Global edition, 2019
courses.recommended_readings: N. Gregory Mankiw, Principles of Economics, 8th edition, 2018, Cengage and Mankiw, N.G., Macroeconomics, 6th Edition or Later Editions, Worth, 2007 +

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Real Estate Finance and Investment
courses.description: In this course, attention will focus on the following issues: the relationship between economic growth and real estate investment, the appraisal of property investment and leasing, the sources and availability of financing for property investment, the legal and regulatory framework underpinning property contracts and mortgage arrangements in Hong Kong (and mainland China), the inter-relationships between property rentals, real estate values and stock market growth and, finally, recent developments and trends in the field of property financing and investment.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course is an introduction to the major concepts, principles, analytical methods and tools useful for making investment decisions regarding residential/commercial real estate assets. The course will cover both the demand-side perspectives pertaining to the investors’ demand on real estate properties and assets, and the supply-side perspectives pertaining to financial industry’s efforts in providing investment products for real estate investors.
courses.course_syllabus: Pro-formas and OCC, Market Value and Investment Value & Real Estate Entrepreneurship, Leverage, Capital Structure, Debt vs Equity Finance, Portfolio Theory & Real Estate, CAPM in Real Estate, REITs, Mortgage Basics, Mortgage Underwriting & Investment, CMBS
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE Questionnaires
Reflection of Instructor
courses.required_readings: Brueggeman, William B. and Jeffrey D. Fisher, Real Estate Finance and Investments (15th Edition or other recent editions.), McGraw-Hill
courses.recommended_readings:
David C. Ling and Wayne R. Archer, 2009, Real Estate Principles: A Value Approach (3nd ed.), McGraw-Hill

Brown & Matysiak, Real Estate Investment, (2000)

Waxman, P. 2004, Investing in Residential Property: Understanding the Australian Property Market (6 Edition), Wrightbooks, Melbourne.

Hence, it combines lectures, problem solving, academic paper reading and case analysis. Lectures and problem sets are used to horn the skills, academic paper reading deepens the understanding, and cases develop our decision-making ability under the complex real-world situation.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Investment Analysis and Portfolio Management
courses.description: This course discusses basic security valuation theories and portfolio management. Emphasis is placed on fundamental common stock analysis, capital market theory, analysis of portfolio performance, market efficiency, and behaviour of stock prices.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisite: FINA2010 or 2310 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken ECON3520.
courses.learning_outcomes: It is intended for students who want to become investment professionals, knowledgeable individual investors, or both.
courses.course_syllabus: The course covers the primary financial securities: bonds, stocks, and derivatives, and methods for combining these underlying assets into a portfolio.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Understanding China's Financial System
courses.description: Over the past decades, China’s financial system has become well-established and developed and plays an increasingly important role in driving the country’s fast economic growth. While there are similarities, China’s financial system is vastly different from those in the West, calling for a close scrutiny. However, most finance courses offered at CUHK and in standard textbooks focus primarily on developed markets, neglecting the uniqueness and complexity of the Chinese market.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3010 or FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: Students are expected to develop deep and comprehensive understanding about China's financial system, about its past history, present condition, and possible future developments.
courses.course_syllabus:
1. An overview of China’s financial system
2. Background: China’s economic reform and development
3. Topic I: The role of state-owned sector
4. Topic II: Immature market infrastructure and inexperienced participants
5. Topic III: Government’s policies and the consequences
6. Topic IV: Future development
7. Conclusion
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings:
1. The Handbook of China's Financial System, Marlene Amstad, Guofeng Sun and Wei Xiong (Eds): Princeton University Press, ISBN 9780691205731, November 2020

2. Risks in China's Financial System, Zheng (Michael) Song and Wei Xiong

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Issues in Finance
courses.description: This course introduces current issues and topics in finance. This is a student-oriented course and students are required to research and discuss articles on related topics. This course provides an opportunity for students to integrate knowledge acquired from finance courses under the guidance of an instructor. Group-based research projects will be conducted. Weekly presentations will be held. Requirements include the writing of reports, formal term-end presentations of papers and participation in class discussions.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course introduces to students interesting issues in finance. Students are expected to do research on relevant topics before attending each class.
courses.course_syllabus: This course features a guest speaker series with a theme of “Into-the-Future”. A number of guest speakers will be invited to share their experiences in areas of their expertise.

Reflection of instructor

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Risk Management and Insurance

meetings.location: Lee Shau Kee Archi Bldg G01
Lee Shau Kee Archi Bldg G01
Lee Shau Kee Archi Bldg G01

courses.description: This course covers risk management concepts; risk identification and measurement; property, net income, and liability loss exposures; analysis of life, property and liability insurance contracts; methods and problems of insurance pricing; and insurance regulation and public policy. In this course, insurance is treated as a major tool of risk management.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, the students should be able to: (1) understand the risk and risk management; (2) apply legal principles in the risk management area; (3) comprehend insurance contracts such as corporate property insurance, liability insurance and life and health insurance; (4) know how insurance companies operate under regulations.
學生們在完成本科目後，應該能夠：（1）瞭解風險與風險管理含意；（2）應用風險管理領域的法律原則；（3）解讀壽險與非壽險的保險合約；（4）認識在監管下的保險公司運作。
courses.course_syllabus:
This course covers risk management concepts; risk identification and measurement; property, net income, and liability loss exposures; analysis of life, property and liability insurance contracts; methods and problems of insurance pricing; and insurance regulation and public policy. In this course, insurance is treated as a major tool of risk management.

Topics below will be covered:
1. Risk and Its Treatment
2. The Insurance Mechanism
3. Fundamentals of Risk Management
4. Legal Principles in Insurance
5. Analysis of Insurance Contracts
6. Liability Risk
7. Fundamentals of Life Insurance
8. Contractual Provisions in Life Insurance
9. Life Insurance Purchase Decisions
10. Selected sections (with local relevance)
11. Types of Insurers and Marketing Systems
12. Insurance Company Operations
13. Financial Operations of Insurers
本科內容包括風險管理之概念；風險之鑒別與衡量；產業、利益、與責任性損失範圍；保險收費之擬定方法與問題；以及政府對保險業所訂之法例與政策等。本科將保險學之探討列為風險管理之主要工具。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Life Contingencies I
courses.description: This course develops the student's knowledge of the theoretical basis of actuarial models and the application of those models to insurance for a single life. Applications include: premium rate for life insurance and annuity contracts, and benefit reserves for insurance contracts.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisite(s): FINA2210 or FINA2200
courses.learning_outcomes:
- define survival-time random variables for one life in the single-decrement model,
- calculate the expected values, variances, probabilities, and percentiles for survival-time random variables,
- define the continuous survival-time random variable that arises from the discrete survival-time random variable using uniform distribution, constant force of mortality, or hyperbolic assumption,
- define present-value-of-benefit random variables defined on survival-time random variables for one life in the single-decrement model,
- define and calculate the expected values, variances and probabilities for present-value-of-benefit random variables and present-value-of-loss-at-issue random variables, as a function of the considerations,
- calculate considerations (premiums) for life insurances and annuities using the Equivalence Principle and using percentile.
- 在單一衰減因素模型下定義一個生命的生存時間隨機變量
- 計算生存時間隨機變量的期望值，方差，概率及百份位數
- 利用離散生存時間隨機變量及死亡均匀分配假定，常數死力假定及雙曲假定定義連續的生存時間隨機變量
- 利用生存時間隨機變量定義保額現值隨機變量
- 計算保額現值隨機變量的期望值，方差及概率
- 利用相等理論及百份位數原理計算人壽及生存年金的保費

courses.course_syllabus:
1. Survival Distributions and Life Tables
- Time-until-death and age-at-death random variables in both discrete and continuous forms; survival distributions; force of mortality; life table functions; random and deterministic survivorship group; introduction of recursion formulae; assumptions for fractional age; analytical laws of mortality; select and ultimate table
2. Life Insurance
- Life insurances with different protection and time of benefit payment provisions; statistical properties of present-value of benefit random variables for different life insurances; portfolio of life insurance
3. Life Annuities
- Life annuities with different payment structures; statistical properties of present-value of annuity payment random variables for different life annuities
4. Benefit Premiums
- Premium principles; statistical properties of insurers loss random variables; fully continuous, fully discrete and semicontinuous benefit premiums
1. 生存函数及生命表
- 餘命及死亡歲數隨機變量，離散及連續形色，生存函数，死力，生命表函数， 隨機及確定生存集合，遞推公式，生命表函数的非整數假定，死力的假定，綜合生命表及檢選生命表
2. 人壽保險
- 人壽保險的不同保護，保額現值的統計性質，保險組合
3. 生存年金
- 各種生存年金及其精算現值的統計性質
4. 保費
- 保費的概念，相等原理，虧損隨機變量的統計性質，全連續，全離散及半連續的保費計算

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Basic Long-term Actuarial Mathematics
courses.description: This course develops the student's knowledge of the theoretical basis of actuarial models and the application of those models to long-term insurance for a single life. Applications include: premium rate for life insurance and annuity contracts, and reserves for insurance contracts.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2200 or FINA2210
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, the students should be able to: gain a deep knowledge in survival distributions and life tables; understand the basic present-value model; apply the present-value model to various life insurance and annuity products; combine basic concepts to determine premiums and reserves for general insurance contracts.

完成科目後，學生應該能夠： 深入了解生存分佈和生命表； 了解基本的現值模型； 將現值模型應用於各種人壽保險和年金產品； 結合基本概念來確定一般保險合同的保費和準備金。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Survival Distributions and Life Tables
- Parametric survival models and life tables, and the associated actuarial functions; select life tables; mortality improvement models
2. Life Insurance
- Life insurances with different protection and time of benefit payment provisions; statistical properties of present-value of benefit random variables for different life insurances; portfolio of life insurance
3. Life Annuities
- Life annuities with different payment structures; statistical properties of present-value of annuity payment random variables for different life annuities
4. Premium and Reserve Calculations
- Premium principles; statistical properties of insurers loss random variables; benefit and gross premium calculation; benefit, gross and modified premium reserve calculation; effect of changes in assumptions; methods for modelling extra risk
5. Option Pricing Fundametals
- Put and call options; binominal option pricing model; Black-Scholes formula; put-call parity

1. 生存分佈和生命表
- 參數生存模型和生命表，以及相關的精算函數； 選擇生命表； 死亡率改善模型
2. 人壽保險
- 具有不同保障和給付時間的人壽保險； 不同人壽保險福利隨機變量現值的統計性質； 人壽保險組合
3. 終身年金
- 不同支付結構的終身年金； 不同人壽年金給付隨機變量現值的統計性質
4. 保費和準備金計算
- 保費原則； 保險公司損失隨機變量的統計特性； 福利和毛保費計算； 福利、總保費和修改後的保費準備金計算； 假設變化的影響； 額外風險建模方法
5. 期權定價基礎
- 看跌期權和看漲期權； 二項式期權定價模型； 布萊克-斯科爾斯公式； 看跌平價

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Basic Short-term Actuarial Mathematics
courses.description: This course develops the student's knowledge of the theoretical basis of actuarial models and the application of those models to short-term insurance. Applications include: premium calculation using credibility; pricing and reserving for short-term insurance coverages; and reinsurance.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2230 or STAT2006 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, the students should be able to: understand the characteristics of and uses for commonly used severity, frequency, and aggregate models; perform parametric and non-parametric estimation; understand the concepts of credibility; calculate premiums and reserves for short-term insurance coverages; identify different forms of individual risk rating plans; and understand the basic operation of reinsurance.

完成科目後，學員應該能夠： 了解常用的嚴重性、頻率和聚合模型的特點和用途； 執行參數和非參數估計； 了解可信度的概念； 計算短期保險的保費和準備金； 識別不同形式的個人風險評級計劃； 並了解再保險的基本操作。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Severity, Frequency and Aggregate Models
- Statistical properties of severity and frequency models; collective and individual risk models; risk measures
2. Parametric and Non-Parametric Estimation
- Parmateric estimation of severity, frequency and aggregate models; non-parametric estimation of survival functions
3. Credibility
- Concept of credibility; limited fluctuation credibility
4. Pricing and Reserving for Short-Term Insurance Coverages
- Techniques for estimating outstanding claims; ratemaking; loss cost and loss ratio methods
5. Individual Risk Rating
- Prospective and Retrospective rating plans
6. Reinsurance
- Proportional and excess of loss reinsurance; reinsurance reserving and pricing

1. 嚴重性、頻率和聚合模型
- 嚴重性和頻率模型的統計特性； 集體和個人風險模型； 風險措施
2. 參數和非參數估計
- 嚴重性、頻率和聚合模型的參數估計； 生存函數的非參數估計
3. 信譽
- 信譽理念； 波動可信度有限
4. 短期保險的定價和準備金
- 估計未決索賠的技術； 費率制定； 損失成本和損失率方法
5. 個人風險評級
- 前瞻性和回顧性評級計劃
6. 再保險
- 比例和超額損失再保險； 再保險準備金和定價

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Life and Health Insurance
courses.description: This course covers laws and regulations of the life and health insurance, needs analysis, the life insurance contract, policy provisions and ownership rights, settlement options, pricing of life products, the underwriting function, medical insurance and long term disability income policies, retirement income and pension plans.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3210.
courses.learning_outcomes:
It is anticipated that after this course students are able to explain the major issues in the operation of life insurance, understand the pricing of life insurance, as well as the factors affecting the competition in life insurance industry. Furthermore, students should be able to explain the major health care issues in America
and Hong Kong, understand the basic characteristics of individual major medical insurance, longterm care insurance, as well as disability-income plans. Students should be able to develop guidelines when purchasing individual health insurance. With knowledge in this course, students should be able to debate on health care policy and health financing reform in Hong Kong.
學生完成本課程後應明瞭人壽保險之運作，定價及其他影響人壽保險業競爭的因子。醫療保險方面，學生應能比較香港及美國的醫療融資問題、明白個人醫療、長期護理及殘疾收入保險計劃的基本特性。修畢本課程後，學生應能自行制定購買個人醫療保險之指引及有足夠背景知識對香港未來醫療融資路向進行探討。
courses.course_syllabus:
Students will gain the understanding of various aspects of life and health insurance. For Life Insurance, topics include economics of life insurance, pricing of life insurance, life insurance company organization and management, underwriting of life insurance and marketing of life insurance.

For Health Insurance, topics include problems of health care in the United States and Hong Kong, the different types of insurance plans and insurance plan coverage,
and the types of managed care organizations and alternative healthcare plans available to patients. The on-going healthcare financing reform in Hong Kong will also be discussed.
學生將會學習人壽及醫療保障的各項知識，包括﹕壽險之經濟理論、定價、壽險公司之架構及管理，核保及市場推廣。在醫保方面，討論項目包括﹕港美醫保制度，各類醫保計劃之細則，管理保健，其他醫保計劃及香港醫療融資計劃等。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Corporate Property and Liability Insurance
courses.description: This course examines risk management and operations of buyers and sellers of insurance. Basic principles and methods for assessing risks facing a non-insurance company and for selecting an optimal risk management programme are discussed in a broad insurance, finance, and statistical context. Because insurance is an important component of a risk management programme, the functional areas of providers of insurance (particularly property and casualty insurers) and the regulatory and market environment in which they operate are also discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3210.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, students are expected to be able to: (1) explain the basic purpose of structure of P&L insurance contract, including coverages, exclusions, limits, and deductibles; (2) identify whether a loss is covered, under which policy/coverage it is covered, the amount of loss, and what portion of the loss is covered; and (3) understand general principles of various functions of non-life insurance companies, so that students can develop analytical perspectives on non-life insurance business.
學生們在完成本科目後，應該能夠：（1） 解釋財產與責任保險合約的基本架構，包括保單條款、除外條款、保險限額、自負額；（2）判斷意外損失是否受保，在何種合約及條款受保，損失金額及受保金額；（3）了解非壽險保險公司各項職能的一般原則，使學生對非壽險保險行業形成分析觀點。
courses.course_syllabus:
This course examines risk management and operations of buyers and sellers of insurance. Basic principles and methods for assessing risks facing a non-insurance company and for selecting an optimal risk management programme are discussed in a broad insurance, finance, and statistical context. Because insurance is an important component of a risk management programme, the functional areas of providers of insurance (particularly property and casualty insurers) and the regulatory and market environment in which they operate are also discussed.
本科旨在探討保險買賣雙方的風險管理及運作。用以評估公司所面臨的風險及選擇最優風險管理的基本原則及方法都在廣泛的保險、財務及統計學的架構下討論。由於保險是風險管理策略的重要環節，對於產物及責任保險公司的運作及其運作的宏觀環境，也有一定程度的討論。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Derivatives for Actuaries I
courses.description: This course aims to provide students with knowledge in derivatives and their applications in pricing and reserving insurance products. Topics include financial forwards, futures, swaps, options; basic insurance strategies; parity relation; binomial option pricing models; the fundamental theorem of asset pricing; foundation of the Black-Scholes model; Brownian motion and stochastic calculus; derivation of Black-Scholes-Merton partial differential equation and Black-Scholes formula; volatility surface. Knowledge in calculus-based probability is assumed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Not for students who have taken FINA4110.
courses.learning_outcomes:
This course studies the mathematical foundation of discrete- and continuous-time finance. The principle of no arbitrage, the binomial tree model, stochastic calculus, the Black-Scholes framework and risk-neutral valuation will be covered in great detail.
After following FINA3250, students are expected to be familiar with the following about rational valuation of derivative securities:
• the principle of no arbitrage, and be able to apply it to price linear derivative securities including financial forward and forward rate agreement
• put-call parity
• the binomial tree model, and be able to apply it to price options
• diffusion process and Itô’s lemma, both the univariate and the multivariate version
• geometric Brownian motion, the Black-Scholes model, and log-normality
• the risk-neutral valuation methodology in continuous-time finance, including the derivation of the Black-Scholes-Merton partial differential equation and the Black-Scholes formula
本科旨在介紹離散與連續時間金融之數學基礎。課程將深入探討套戥、二項式模型、隨機微積分、畢蘇模型、與風險中性定價原理。
完成FINA3250的學生將熟習以下關於衍生工具合理定價之原則：
• 無套利假設以及其於線性衍生工具 (包括金融遠期合約及遠期利率協議) 定價之應用
• 期權等價理論
• 二項式模型以及其於期權定價之應用
• 擴散過程及一元與多元伊藤引理
• 幾何布朗運動、畢蘇模型，及對數正態性
• 連續時間金融之風險中性定價原理，包括Black-Scholes-Merton 偏微分方程和畢蘇期權定價公式
courses.course_syllabus:
(1) Introduction to derivatives securities:
Financial forwards, currency forwards, futures and futures indexes, interest rate and commodity swaps, call and put options, spreads, put-call parity, early exercise, comparing options with respect to maturity and strike
(2) Binomial option pricing:
Pricing European and Ameerican derivatives using single and multi-period tree on stock, futures and foreign currencies, Arrow-Debreu securities
(3) Stock price process:
Random walk, Brownian motion, geometric Brownian motion, stochastic differential equation, Itô’s lemma
(4) The Black-Scholes model:
Market price of risk, Girsanov theorem, derivation of Black-Scholes-Merton partial differential equation, Feynman-Kac theorem and risk-neutral pricing, European binary options and Black-Scholes formula, historical and implied volatility estimation
(1) 衍生工具簡介：
金融遠期合約、匯率遠期合約、期貨與期指、利率與商品掉期、認購期權與認沽期權，跨期式組合，期權等價理論，提前履约，以到期日和行使價比較期權價值。
(2) 二項式模型：
利用股票、期貨及匯率之單期及多期二項樹運算歐式和美式衍生工具之價值， Arrow-Debreu証券。
(3) 股價過程：
隨機漫步、布朗運動、幾何布朗運動、隨機微分方程、伊藤引理。
(4) 畢蘇模型：
市場風險價格，吉爾薩諾夫定理，Black-Scholes-Merton偏微分方程之推導，費曼-凱克定理與風險中性定價原理，歐式二元期權與畢蘇期權定價公式，歷史波幅與引伸波幅之估計。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Internship Experience
courses.description: Internship experience in approved departments of banks, insurance companies or related financial institutions for two to three months. A written report should be submitted for evaluation.
courses.learning_outcomes:
To let students have exposure to the practical environment other than learning in class. Such experience will greatly enhance the quality of education provided by the university and improve our students' competitiveness in the job market.
本科主要讓同學到實際的工作環境實習。這種在課堂以外學習的經驗可大大提高大學教育的素質及增強學生們在職場上的競爭力。
courses.course_syllabus:
Internship experience in approved departments of banks, insurance companies or related financial institutions for two to three months. A written report should be submitted for evaluation.
學生將到一個獲許可之銀行、保險公司或其他相關之財務機構的部門實習二到三個月。實習期間，學生獲取保險、財務或精算相關工作的經驗。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
~ E-mail communications with the instructor.
~ Performance in essay/presentation. Assessment of what has been achieved by the students.
courses.required_readings: No required reading is needed because this internship course is for students who have completed their internship in approved department of banks, insurance companies or related financial institutions for two or three months, and need to submit a written report with real life working experience for evaluation.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Linear Models for Actuaries
courses.description: A generalized linear model (GLM) allows explicit assumptions to be made about the nature of the insurance data and its relationship with predictive variables. It also provides a statistically sounded method to test and validate models, and hence it finds huge applications in underwriting and ratemaking of non-life insurances. This course investigates GLM with applications in actuarial analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisites: FINA2230 or STAT2006 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The primary objective of this course is to introduce regression and generalized linear models. After finishing the course, students would be able to use statistical packages to fit different regression models, interpret parameters, effects, interaction of exogenous variables for the classical model as well as generalized linear models for longitudinal data, particularly data in the field of insurance.

本科旨在介紹迴歸與廣義線性模型。完成本科後，學生將能利用統計軟件估計和解釋這兩類模型之模型參數、利用模型研究不同外生變數之重要性與及相互關係。學生將可運用這兩類模型分析縱向(特別是保險業中常見的) 數據。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics include:
Correlation analysis, simple and multiple classical linear regression, heteroscedastic models, GLM, link function, diagnostic tests, goodness-of-fit, applications in actuarial science.
Statistical package will be used in conducting analysis.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
- Course Teaching Evaluation (to be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures)
- Student-staff consultation meeting
- E-mail communication with the instructor

- Fox and Weisberg, 2011. An R Companion to Applied Regression, 2nd Ed., Sage Publications

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Advanced Statistical Modeling for Insurance and Finance
courses.description:
Time series modeling and statistical learning techniques have found a lot of applications in insurance and finance such as insurance underwriting, policyholder’s behavior analysis, analysis of shape of yield curve, and developing asset allocation algorithms for equity portfolios.
The primary objective of this course is to equip students with the knowledge of contemporary statistical modeling technique to make proper interpretations and select appropriate techniques for analyzing insurance and financial data.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Pre-requisites: DOTE2021 or FINA2230 or STAT2006 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
This is a course on statistical modeling. Time series models and supervised and unsupervised statistical learning would be covered. In addition to learning the methods, students would understand the underlying assumptions and how to implement the methods using appropriate statistical package such as R to real-world data sets upon completing of the course.

本科旨在介紹時間序列與監督式和非監督式統計學習。除方法外，學生在修畢本科後會理解不同統計學習方法之假設，應用統計軟件 (如 R) 執行與解釋分析結果。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics include:
For time series: white noise processes, autocorrelation, stationarity, AR and ARCH models.
For unsupervised learning methods: principal component analysis and cluster analysis.
For supervised learning methods: nonlinear regression and decision trees.

題目包括︰
時間序列︰白噪音過程、自相關係數、平穩性、AR 和ARCH模型﹔
非監督式學習︰主成份分析與聚類分析﹔
監督式學習︰非線性迴歸與決策樹。

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Introduction to Investment Banking
courses.description: This course introduces students to the investment banking industry. Topics include the development of the investment banking industry, the equity, debt and merger & acquisition markets, different functional areas of the investment banks, special issues relating to the industry (e.g. insider trading, compensation etc.), prospective changes in the regulatory environment of the industry, as well as a future outlook of the investment banking career in Asia.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The primary objective of this course is to provide an introduction to the theories and practices of investment banking. At the end of the semester, student sare expected to be able to:

~ have an overview of the investment banking industry
~ identify the key functions of an investment bank
~ understand the major controversial issues of the investment banking industry
~ understand the possible directions of regulatory reforms in the Western markets as well as in Asia
courses.course_syllabus: This course introduces students to the investment banking industry. Topics include the development of the investment banking industry, the equity, debt and merger & acquisition markets, different functional areas of the investment banks, special issues relating to the industry (e.g. insider trading, compensation etc.), prospective changes in the regulatory environment of the industry, as well as a future outlook of the investment banking career in Asia.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Introduction to Credit Rating
courses.description: This course introduces students to the credit rating industry and rating methodologies. Topics covered include the development of the credit rating industry, the rating methodologies for corporate/sovereign and structured finance (including methodology comparison among the three rating agencies), as well as the rating agency developments in Asia. (QFIN students will have priorities to take this course.)
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
Credit rating agencies play a very important role in the global financial markets. The increasing publicity associated with the credit rating industry, and the vast career opportunities offered by various department of credit rating agencies, call for a need to more thoroughly understand what credit rating agencies do and the function they perform in the financial markets. The objectives of this credit rating course are to:

~ Provide students with a fundamental understanding of the role of credit rating agencies and how they operate, including Asia;

~ Provide a framework for the analysis of the key business lines of a credit rating agency; and

~ Provide a framework of reference for future professionals in the credit rating industry.
courses.course_syllabus:
1 Credit Rating Introduction
~ Background to rating agencies
~ Overview of rating scales & definitions
~ Investment grade vs. non-investment grade
~ National vs. international rating
~ Default probabilities & recovery ratings
~ Limitations of credit rating

2 Corporate and Financial Institution Rating
~ Key rating terminologies
~ Credit rating process
~ Quantitative vs. quantitative consideration
~ Sovereign/country risk

3 Securitisation and Covered Bond Rating
~ Key securitisation and CB terminologies
~ SF/CB credit rating process
~ SF/CB credit modeling
~ SF/CB legal documentation

4 Credit Rating Special Topics
~ Credit rating industry
~ Credit rating agency
~ Corporate credit rating transition & default studies
~ Structured finance credit rating transition & default studies
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors
courses.required_readings: Lecture notes will be provided in each class. No additional textbook is required.
courses.recommended_readings: The Rating Agencies and Their Credit Ratings: What They Are, How They Work, and Why They are Relevant (Herwig M. Langohr and Patricia T. Langohr, Wiley c2008)

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Introduction to Alternative Investment
courses.description: This course broadens the investment paradigm by introducing the alternative investments that are not covered in typical finance courses. This includes hedge funds, private equity, venture capital, real estate and real estate investment trust, closely-held companies and inactively traded securities, distressed securities and bankruptcies, and commodity markets and commodity derivatives.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The primary objective of this course is to provide an introduction to the world of alternative investments. At the end of the course, students are expected to be able to:

~ have a basic knowledge of the operations of the alternative investment markets
~ understand the tools and techniques used in the alternative investment markets
~ understand the return-risk characteristics of alternative investments
~ understand related technical publications and how to construct a portfolio using them
courses.course_syllabus:
Hedge Funds A general introduction to different hedge fund strategies. Why asset allocators should consider hedge funds? Discussion of empirical performances.

Private Equity and Venture Capital A general introduction to different private equity and venture capital strategies. Compare and contrast the risk reward profiles of these two strategies. Discussion of empirical performances.

Real Estate, Managed Futures, Commodities, and Derivatives A general introduction to real estate, managed futures, commodities, and derivatives as alternative investment strategies. Compare and contrast the investment merits of these strategies.

Performance and risk measurements A general introduction to performance measurement considerations, including returns calculation, risk metrics, and the impact of management and performance fees to net investor returns. A general discussion to operational due diligence when asset allocators conduct manager selections.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
Focus group discussions with at least two small groups of students
CTE Questionnaires
Reflection of instructors

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Trading Strategies: Behavioral and Technical Analysis
courses.description: This course introduces the theories and practices of investment trading strategies that are based on past price history. The objective is to develop the students' capability in reading the minds of the market psychology studies. The course also covers investor behavioral biases as well as major trading principles in technical analysis. Issues to be discussed include identifying trends and price action, stop loss and price target, supply/demand situations of the underlying assets, human behaviour, emotions of fear and greed and the relationship with fundamental analysis.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken FINA3012.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The primary objective of this course is to provide an introduction to the theories and practices of trading strategies based on past price history. At the end of the course, students are expected to be able to:

~ have a basic knowledge of technical analysis
~ understand the concepts behind sophisticated analytical tools and techniques
~ rationalize the relationship between technical analysis and fundamental analysis

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Foreign Exchange Market Practices
courses.description: This course studies the business and strategy issues of investing in the global foreign exchange market. The objective is to develop the students' capability in reading the minds of the market psychology studies. Topics include assessing global political, economic and social conditions, globalization of national economic policies, ascertaining market focus, strategy of surrendering to market trend, assessing the value of technical analysis, psychology of speculation, money management rules, etc.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken FINA3021.
courses.learning_outcomes:
The primary objective of this course is to provide an introduction to the theories and practices in foreign exchange. At the end of the course, students are expected to be able to:

~ have a basic knowledge of the operations of the foreign exchange markets
~ understand the tools and techniques used in the foreign exchange markets
~ rationalize the relationship between technical analysis and fundamental analysis in exchange rate forecasting
~ create analytical tools in trading foreign exchange products
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Foreign exchange market basics:

Introduce the basic market instruments in FX market and typical trading strategies.

* Deliverable forwards, Non-deliverable forwards, FX swap points, Vanilla Options, Call Put
* Typical behavior of currency during risk-on / risk-off

2. Trading example (tentative):

* USDHKD: Discuss how USDHKD currency board mechanism works. Market dynamic when USDHKD is under pressure.
* USDSGD: Discuss SGDNEER basket policy,MAS intervention and its implications
* USDCNH: Discuss the dynamic in USDCNH and USDCNY market using China-US Trade war as an example,
* USDTWD: Discuss current account characteristics and how Lifers hedge activities influence the FX market
* USDJPY: How the Abenomics and QQE policy adopted by BOJ impacted the currency market.

3. Current FX market issues:

Briefly discuss the current issue in FX market. E.g. Fed rate hike, US-China trade war, etc (Depends on latest market development)

courses.title: Derivative Warrants, Proprietary and Arbitrage Trading Concepts
courses.description: This course aims to provide students with real life examples of trading strategies commonly used by investment banks and hedged funds. The objective is to enable students to apply financial theories into real life practice and understand the principles and difficulties/limitations behind it. Topics to be discussed include hedging, market making and arbitraging of derivative warrants and CBBCs, volatility arbitrage, Tracker Fund trading, A50 ETF premium/discount arbitrage, Hang Seng Index rebalancing opportunities, index arbitrage and delta one trading.

courses.description: This course covers the basic issues and principles of fundamental analysis, which deals with the valuation of a firm's equity shares and debt by using macroeconomic and industry information, financial statements, financial forecasting, financial modeling, discounted cash flow method of equity valuation, and development of techniques for valuing equity and fixed income securities research.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Fund Management and Asset Allocation
courses.description: This course offers a practical, "real world" understanding of mutual fund management in Hong Kong. The course will begin with a review of modern portfolio theory, followed by detailed discussions on topics including types of mutual funds, portfolio selection and asset allocation, passive versus active investment strategies, fund rating, fund house operations in Hong Kong, as well as mutual fund distribution strategies. Senior fund managers will be invited to share their valuable experiences at class.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course aims to introduce to students the fundamental concepts of fund management and activities and asset allocation theories, process and tools. Some empirical studies show that asset allocation decision accounts for more than 90% of the portfolio's return, while the rest can be attributed to managers' active selection ability at individual security level. The subsequent monitoring and rebalancing of the portfolio(s) to make sure the performance adhere to the defined goal and risk tolerance level will be another focus of this course.
courses.course_syllabus:
Overview of historical characteristics of various asset classes
Asset allocation concepts & Bloomberg Training session
Decision on asset mix
Risk Management & Hedging
Portfolio rebalancing
Active Vs Passive management
Bond Portfolio Management
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors

1) David M. Darst, The Arts of Asset Allocation, McGraw-Hill-Irwin, 2003 (AAA)
2) Canto, Victor, Understanding Asset Allocation, Prentice Hall, 2005 (UAA)
3) Black, Keith H., Managing a Hedge Fund, McGraw Hill,2004 (MHF)

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Selected Topics in Finance
courses.description: This course will focus on special Issues selected by the Department. Students are advised to contact the department for current offerings.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: After completion of the course, student should be able to gain the latest perspective on different financial issues and topics.
courses.course_syllabus: Depends on the topics selected by the course teacher. Assessment scheme is at the discretion of the course teacher.
courses.feedback_evaluation: Mandatory Course and Teaching Evaluation (CTE) is conducted at the end of the course.
courses.required_readings: To be assigned by course teacher.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Cases in Corporate Finance
courses.description: This course is designed to apply the materials learned in financial management to study cases in corporate finance. The cases include capital budgeting under uncertainty with emphasis on the net present value rule, internal rate of return rule and (discounted) payback rule, replacement of old equipment by new equipment, estimation of cost of equity, cost of debt and weighted average cost of capital, the implications of the capital asset pricing model and the arbitrage pricing model, the dividend discount model, optimal capital structure and the free cash flow model.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3070 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: Provide a conceptual framework that will allow students to make financing and investment decisions that will benefit their career and them personally. Toward this goal, this course presents the theoretical and institutional framework that underlies corporate finance and, primarily through the vehicle of case analysis.
courses.course_syllabus:
NPV and Time Value of Money
Capital budget and Valuation
Cost of Capital Valuation
Valuing and Selecting Investment Opportunities and Capital Budgeting
CAPM and Empirical Evidence
Weighted Average Cost of Capital
CAPM and Valuation
Advanced Valuation – Initial Public Offering
Capital Structure Decisions
Dividend Policy
Cash Distribution
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructor
courses.required_readings: Case Studies in Finance by Bruner/Eades/Schill, Eighth Edition (International Student Edition), McGraw Hill.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Mergers and Acquisitions
courses.description: This course is designed to provide an overview of current issues and recent developments in the area of acquisition/merger policy, performance and analysis. This course will focus on the following areas: 1) forms of takeover mechanism and their historical incidence in Hong Kong, 2) causes and motivations for acquisition/merger, 3) the impact on the stock prices of the corporate raider and its target, 4) the Hong Kong regulations relating to mergers and, finally, 5) a consideration of the general effect of mergers/acquisitions upon national economic performance.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3070 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course is designed to integrate the materials of financial management and investments to analyze the merger and acquisition (takeover) markets. Students are required to apply the efficient market hypothesis to analyze the stock market responses to takeover announcements; the welfare gains or losses to shareholders will be computed. It is also required to compute the cost of capital and to future compute the intrinsic value of targets by using the price multiples, dividend discount model and the free cash model.
courses.course_syllabus:
~ Introduction to Mergers and Acquisitions and Corporate Strategy
~ Introduction to ISC and IPD
~ ISC in Marketing and Financial Management
~ ISC in Business Innovation and Entrepreneurship
~ IPD in Business Diversification
~ ISC and IPD in Cross-border Acquisitions
~ Financial Decision - Making Tools
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructor
courses.required_readings: Mergers, Acquisitions, and Other Restructuring Activities, by Donald DePamphilis. Elsevier. ISBN: 978-0-12-801609-1

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: China Finance
courses.description: This course provides students with a basic understanding of China finance. It covers the following areas: China's markets for securities and foreign exchange, their regulatory framework, price behaviour and efficiency, recent developments and trends; the ownership structure, capital structure, dividend policy, and project financing of state-owned as well as privately-owned corporations. Important current issues will also be discussed.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA2010 or FINA2310 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course serves to help students in studying and understanding the financial market and financial institutions in China. The history of the capital market in China and its current issues will be addressed.
courses.course_syllabus: The course consists of two parts. The first part consists of nine lectures where I lay out the overall landscape of China Finance. The second part is mostly student-oriented learning where students carry out their own research on China Finance. Students will form groups to present ideas, findings, and any other interesting matters.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE questionnaires
Reflection of instructors
courses.required_readings: ~ Privatizing China: Inside China Stock Market, Carl E. Walter and Fraser J.H. Howie, John Wiley & Sons (Asia) Pte. Ltd.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Options and Futures
courses.description: This course aims to discuss the basic operations of the options and futures markets. It analyses option pricing models, investment strategies involving options and futures, and the roles of hedgers and investors in these markets. Other major topics include comparisons of options and futures contracts issued by different exchanges and their trading regulations.
courses.enrollment_requirement:
1. Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
2. Not for students who have taken ECON4450.
courses.learning_outcomes:
This course is designed to study derivative securities and markets. Three fundamental issues will be addressed: operations of various derivative markets; pricing of derivative assets; and their applications in investments and financial management.

The course is conceptual in orientation due to the nature of the material covered. However, practical applications are emphasised. The key is to understand the basic concepts of the subject matter and to relate them to real-world financial issues. The students are expected to have some knowledge of calculus and statistics.
courses.course_syllabus:
Futures Markets,
Hedging with futures & Forward and Futures Pricing
Interest Rate futures & Swaps
Mechanics of Options markets & Property of stock option
Option trading strategy
Binomial Trees Model
Black-Scholes option model
Options on Stock Indices, Currencies & Futures options
Option Risk – Greek Letters
Volatility Prediction
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE Questionnaires
Reflection of instructors

~ Cases in Financial Engineering: Applied Studies of Financial Innovation, Scott P. Mason, Robert C Merton, Andre F. Perold and Perter Tufano, Prentice-Hall, 1995

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Fixed Income Securities Analysis
courses.description: The focus of this course is on the valuation of fixed-income securities and investment techniques in managing fixed-income portfolios. Topics include the term structures of interest rates and forward rates; bond pricing, interest rate and reinvestment risks; risk and hedging in bond portfolio management; duration, convexity and portfolio immunization; corporate bonds, emerging-market bonds and default risks; fixed-income securities with embedded options; callable and convertible bonds, mortgage-backed securities; interest rate derivatives; and interest rate futures, swaps, caps and floors.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: After taking this course, students are able to understand the basic characteristics of fixed-income securities, their market convention and trading mechanism.
courses.course_syllabus: Pricing of Bonds, Measure yield, Bond Price Volatility, Treasury and Agency Securities, Corporate Debt Instruments, Residual Mortgage loans, Asset-Backed Securities, Collateralized Debt Obligations, Interest Rate Models, Bonds with Embedded Options, Residential Mortgage-Backed Securities, Convertible Bonds, Corporate Bond Credit Analysis, Credit Risk Modeling, Indexing, Interest-Rate Futures Contracts, Credit Derivatives
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE Questionnaires
Reflection of instructors

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Empirical Finance
courses.description: This course is designed to apply mathematical and statistical/econometric techniques to financial issues. Topics include mean-variance portfolio analysis; regression and time series analysis of financial data; forecasting and simulations in financial applications. This course involves extensive usage of computers and relevant software packages.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: After taking this course, students are able to understand how mathematical and econometric techniques are used in financial research and decision-making.
courses.course_syllabus: Major topics in financial economics are covered including modern portfolio theory, capital asset pricing models, efficient markets hypothesis, and models of time-varying volatility, with an emphasis on empirical applications of theoretical concepts using computer software programmes.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Computational Finance
courses.description: Computational finance is an interdisciplinary subject of probability theory, finance, and numerical analysis. The emphasis of this course is on computational methods and mathematical models for various asset pricing and risk management problems. Computational issues on implementing common financial models will be discussed. Standard as well as exotic derivatives on equities, indices, and interest rate will be introduced; different computational methods are used for their pricing and hedging, these include pricing by formulas and approximations, pricing using lattices, and pricing using Monte Carlo simulation. Before taking this course, students are expected to have good knowledge in at least one computer language.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: Through extensive use of the securities trading and research laboratory, students are expected to be familiar with trading of financial derivatives in a real world setting.
courses.course_syllabus: Topics to be discussed include trading of financial derivatives in general, theory behind liquidity providing and market making, pure arbitrage, statistical arbitrage, market making, hedging strategies, and risk management.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Quantitative Methods for Financial Derivatives
courses.description: This course develops the quantitative methods for stochastic models of financial markets and pricing financial derivative securities. Topics will include: arbitrage, interest rate and discounted value; hedging strategies and risk management; geometric random walk and Brownian motion as models of risky assets; initial boundary value problems for the heat and related partial differential equations; self-financing replicating portfolio; Black-Scholes pricing of European options; term structure models and interest rate derivatives; Girsanov theory and equivalent martingale measures; optimal stopping and American options. Before taking this course, students are expected to have good knowledge in probability theory and differential equations.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: Through extensive use of the securities trading and research laboratory, students are expected to be familiar with trading of financial derivatives in a real world setting.
courses.course_syllabus: Trading of financial derivatives in general, theory behind liquidity providing and market making, pure arbitrage, option theory in practice, statistical arbitrage/ market making options, hedging strategies and risk management.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Intermediate Financial Theory
courses.description: This course presents and develops many of the important concepts in finance. The major focus is on single-period models of financial markets and the valuation of simple financial claims traded in those markets. Topics will include: models of choice under uncertainty, risk aversion, and stochastic dominance; single-period portfolio optimization problems and equilibrium models of asset markets; mutual fund separation theorems and aggregation theorems; introduction to asset markets and portfolio choice in a multi-period context; financial decisions of firms and the Modigliani-Miller theorems; financial equilibrium with differential information. Before taking this course, students are expected to have good knowledge in microeconomic theory and advanced calculus.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3080 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: This course presents and develops many of the important concepts in finance as a natural extension of microeconomic and general equilibrium theory. The major focus is on single-period models of financial markets and the valuation of simple financial claims traded in those markets.
courses.course_syllabus: Topics will include: models of choice under uncertainly, risk aversion, and stochastic dominance; single-period portfolio optimization problems and equilibrium models of asset markets; mutual fund separation theorems and aggregation theorems; introduction to asset markets and porfolio choice in a multi-period context; financial decisions of firms and the Modigliani-Miller theorems; financial equilibrium with differential information.

CTE Questionnaires

Danthine, Jean‐Pierre, and John B. Donaldson, 2015, Intermediate Financial Theory, third edition (Academic Press)
courses.recommended_readings:

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Research Project in Quantitative Finance
courses.description: A student or a group of students (maximum of three) may enrol on this special directed study of selected issues in finance with the permission and under the supervision of an instructor. The content of the course will depend on the research plans of the students. A written report should be submitted for evaluation, and a final presentation to members of the Department of Finance should be made at the end of the project.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: At least two FINA41XX courses and permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes: The Project Report provides students with a chance to make an in-depth study of a specific topic in finance. It allows them to show their abilities in areas outside those that are normally tested in examinations. They are required to sift and critically evaluate large quantities of information, to take theoretical knowledge and apply it in a “real life” situation, and to develop their own answers to a unique problem. The demand on the knowledge and skills students have developed during their studies will be high. The project will test powers of self-direction, ability to self-organize and capacity to adapt to demanding working circumstances. The main purpose of the research study must be to provide a learning experience for the student.
courses.course_syllabus: There is no specific course syllabus for this course. The Research Project is an extensive task that demands considerable individual efforts from students and the application of a wide range of research skills. The aim is to test the ability of students to undertake an original investigation; present the findings of that investigation in an orderly, reasoned and analytical manner.
courses.feedback_evaluation:
CTE Questionnaires
Reflection of instructor

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Life Contingencies II
courses.description: This is the second course in life contingencies mathematics. Pricing, valuation and profit calculation are the three pillars of actuarial work. This course develops the student’s practical knowledge of life contingencies developed in FINA3220 in these three areas.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3220 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After the completion of this course, students should be familiar with the following about life contingencies mathematics:
Net and gross premium reserve, profit calculation of life insurance policies, life table estimation, multiple decrement model and applications in pension, longevity risk modeling.

成功修畢本科後，學生會熟知下列關於壽險數學之知識︰
人壽保險淨保費儲備金與毛保費儲備金和利潤之計算、生命表之估計、多重脫退模型及其在退休保障中之應用、長壽風險模型。
courses.course_syllabus:
Topics include:
(1) Valuation: Net premium reserve, gross premium reserve, expense reserve, modified reserve, and zeroized reserve; prospective, retrospective and recursive calculation.
(2) Multiple decrement models: forces of decrements, dependent and independent rates of decrements, surrender charge and cash value, projection of asset share, policy alteration, applications in pension plans involving the calculation of accrued liability and normal costs.
(3) Profit testing: premium, reserve and profit test basis; actual profit, profit decomposition, cash flow, profit vector and profit signature, other profit measures such as net present value and internal rate of return.
(4) Estimation of life table and multiple decrement table.
(5) Introduction to longevity risk modeling, as exemplified by the Lee-Carter model.

內容包括：
(1) 儲備金：淨保費儲備金與毛保費儲備金、費用儲備金、修正儲備金、零化儲備金﹔前瞻性、回溯性、遞迴運算法。
(2) 多重脫退模型：瞬時減員力、獨立與相關減員概率、退保費用與現值、資產淨值之估算、保單改變、對退休計劃之應計負債與正常成本的計算的應用。
(3) 利潤檢測：保費、儲備金與利潤基礎﹔真實利潤、利潤分解、現金流、利潤向量和利潤預期、其他利潤測度如淨現值和內在收益率。
(4) 生命表和多重脫退模表的估計。
(5) 長壽風險模型簡介，以Lee-Carter 模型為一個例子。
courses.feedback_evaluation:
• Course Teaching Evaluation (to be conducted during the last two weeks of lectures)
• Student-staff consultation meeting
• E-mail communication with the instructor

courses.recommended_readings: ~ Bowers, Gerber, Hickman, Jones and Nesbitt, 1997. Actuarial Mathematics, 2nd Ed., The Society of Actuaries.

courses.subject: FINA
courses.title: Advanced Long-term Actuarial Mathematics
courses.description: This course develops the student's knowledge of the advanced theories and their applications to long-term insurance for a single life and multiple lives. Applications include: premium and reserve calculation for long-term state-dependent insurance coverages, profit analysis, funding calculation for pension plans and retirement benefits, and evaluation of embedded options in long-term insurance products.
courses.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisite: FINA3221 or permission from instructor.
courses.learning_outcomes:
After completing the course, the students should be able to: understand, apply and estimate the survival models for multiple state contingent cashflows; calculate the premium and reserve for long-term state-dependent insurance coverages; analyze emerging surplus using profit testing; understand how retirement benefits are accrued, valued, and funded; and manage the long-term insurance products with embedded guarantees and options.

完成科目後，學生應該能夠： 理解、應用和估計多狀態或有現金流的生存模型； 計算長期狀態依賴保險的保費和準備金； 使用利潤測試分析新出現的盈餘； 了解退休福利是如何累積、估價和資助的； 並管理具有嵌入式保證和選項的長期保險產品。
courses.course_syllabus:
1. Survival Models for Multiple State Contingent Cashflows
- Markov multiple state models; Kolmogorov’s forward equations; Chapman-Kolmogorov equations; joint-life mortality models
2. Estimation in the Multiple State Model
- Estimation and construction of multiple state and joint life models for insurance and annuity contracts
3. Premium and Reserve Calculation for Long-Term State-Dependent Coverages
- Multiple state dependent insurance and annuity models; Woolhouse approximations; premium and reserve calculation
4. Profit Analysis
- Profit testing for setting premiums and reserves; analysis of emerging surplus
5. Pension Plans and Retirement Benefits
- Defined contribution (DC) and defined benefit (DB) plans; replacment ratio; pension plan valuation
6. Embedded Options in Life Insurance and Annuity Products
- Payoffs of embedded options in insurance and annuity contracts; valuation of embedeed options using Black-Scholes model; delta-hedging; scenairo-based profit testing

1. 多狀態或有現金流的生存模型
- 馬爾可夫多狀態模型； Kolmogorov 的前向方程； Chapman-Kolmogorov 方程； 共同生命死亡率模型
2. 多狀態模型中的估計
- 保險和年金合同的多個狀態和聯合人壽模型的估計和構建
3. 長期狀態相關保險的保費和準備金計算
- 多種國家依賴保險和年金模式； 伍爾豪斯近似； 保費和準備金計算
4. 利潤分析
- 設置保費和準備金的利潤測試； 新興盈餘分析
5. 養老金計劃和退休福利
- 固定繳款（DC）和固定收益（DB）計劃； 置換率； 養老金計劃估值
6. 人壽保險和年金產品的嵌入式期權
- 保險和年金合同中嵌入期權的收益； 使用 Black-Scholes 模型對嵌入期權進行估值； delta對沖； 基於場景的利潤測試
